document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomical, ecological and zoogeographical studies on anisitsiellid water mites (Acari: Hydrachnidia: Anisitsiellidae Koenike, 1910) from Madagascar

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomical, ecological and zoogeographical studies on anisitsiellid water mites (Acari: Hydrachnidia: Anisitsiellidae Koenike, 1910) from Madagascar

materialsCitation.location: Riviere de Manques in Reserve Fontenay

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Holotype female
, MD 155 a, Joffreville ( Montagne d’Ambre , Antsiranana ), left tributary Rivière de Manques in Reserve Fontenay ,
600 m asl
, 21.2 °C, 19 µS/cm,
17.11.2001
, mounted.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Additional material examined:
MD 38 a, Andrambovato ( Fianarantsoa ), stream 3 km east from the village upstream from the cascade, riffle,
900 m asl
,
20.08.2001
, 0/1/0 mounted
;
MD 64 , Andohahela ( Tulear ), Fenoevo , stream at northern margin of forest (milky turbid waters),
330 m asl
, 19.4 °C, 100 µS/cm,
08.09.2001
, 0/1/0 mounted
;
MD 70 , Andohahela ( Tulear ), Isaka , east stream at the southern National Park border (west RIP 118 ),
200 m asl
, 19.5 °C, 89 µS/cm,
09.09.2001
, 0/1/0 mounted, 0/1/0 unmounted
;
MD 74 a Andohahela ( Tulear ), Isaka , stream crossing RIP 118 at km
32, 360 m asl
, 18.8 °C, 88 µS/cm,
11.09.2001
, 0/ 1/0 mounted, 0/1/0 unmounted
.
Distribution: Madagascar (Montagne d’Ambre, Eastern and Southern hill regions).
Derivatio nominis: Volo (Malagasy) — hair; vitsy (Malagasy) — few; referring to the characteristically weak setation of the legs of the species.

Diagnosis: Idiosoma elongated; dorsal shield elongated-oval, margin undulated, ridge on dorsal shield posteriorly clearly developed, anterior barely visible; coxal field relatively compact, Cx-I to -III together boxshaped, capitular bay shallow, medial margins of Cx-I long, fused, of Cx-III mid-sized; genital field elongated; acetabula mid-sized, oval; leg-I and -II relatively short, leg-III and -IV slender, claws on leg-I to -III angled, with comb-like ventral clawlets, without dorsal clawlet; leg-IV-6 with two mid-sized terminal setae; base of capitulum high, compact, rostrum with shorter keel; palp typical, ventral margin of P2 concave, medially with ventro-distal corner, P5 long.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 272–281. 272, 273, 279 .
Platymamersopsis ( Lavorona ) volovitsy
subgen. et sp. nov.
, female holotype (MD 155a). 274–278, 280, 281.
Platymamersopsis ( Lavorona ) volovitsy
subgen. et sp. nov.
, female (MD 70): 272, idiosoma, ventral view; 273, idiosoma, dorsal view; 274, leg-I-2 to -6; 275, leg-II-2 to -6; 276, leg-III; 277, leg-IV; 278, capitulum with chelicera, lateral view; 279, capitulum with chelicera, latero-ventral view; 280, left palp, lateral view; 281, right palp, medial view. Scale bars = 100 µm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks: The two species of
Platymamersopsis ( Lavorona )
are distinguished by the shape of their idiosoma, gnathosoma and legs: The idiosoma is rounded oval in
P. ( Lavorona ) pinocchio
— elongated in
P. ( Lavorona ) volovitsy
; the legs are relatively compact in
P. ( Lavorona ) pinocchio
— slenderer in
P. ( Lavorona ) volovitsy
; the claws on leg-I to-III bear fine dorsal clawlets in
P. ( Lavorona ) pinocchio
— dorsal clawlets lacking in
P. ( Lavorona ) volovitsy
; the rostrum as well as the P5 are long and slender in
P. ( Lavorona ) pinocchio
— both are shorter in
P. ( Lavorona ) volovitsy
. Furthermore
Platymamersopsis ( Lavorona ) pinocchio
has dense rows of strong ventral setae on leg-IV-5 and -6 — these are lacking in
P. ( Lavorona ) volovitsy
.
